ruleset.name: Apex Code Style Rules
ruleset.description: Custom rules for Apex code style (formatting, naming conventions, code style patterns)

rule.name: VariablesMustNotShareNamesWithClasses
rule.message: Variable names must not share names with classes to avoid confusion and improve code clarity
rule.description:
Variable names should not exactly match class names to avoid confusion. When a variable shares an exact name with a class, it can be unclear whether the identifier refers to the class or an instance, making the code harder to read and understand.
Allowed patterns: - Plurals: If a class is called "Quote", you can call a variable "quotes" - Single letters: If a class is called "Request", you can call a variable "r" - Variables containing the class name: If a class is called "Dress", you can call a variable "myDress", "dressItem", "redDress", or "dresses", but not "dress" (exact match)
Version: 1.0.0
